40914999.review:
EDF:Servicio de fumigaciones contra plagas domesticas ,  100% garantizado.

(el  juego esta bloqueado a 30 fps por defecto, toma en cuenta   que hay una modificación disonible  para desblqoeuar el framerate en el punto de encuentro, creditos corresondientes al modder. punto en contra  menos   para el juego  )

Spinoff de la poco conocida franquicia Tps Japones frenetico  que parodia  con un poco malo  sentido del humor  elem,enmtos de la speliculas estadounidenses serie b  de bajo presupuesto de  ciencia ficcion de los 50's  y principio  de los 60's(Them! (1954),  The Beginning of the End (1957))  ademas  los generos japones del Kaijueiga(Mountruos gigantes Godzilla, Mothra ) y el Tokusatsu (Los kamen Raider , Power Rangers, ultraman ) y por que no que es evidente en impresiones otras reseñas ciertos aires Heinleniados a la Starship Troopers (tanto novela original  como  la  muy poco fiel pelicula de Verhoeven).  Esta vez desarollado por un estudio occidental  comparandolo con su antecesor no cornologico  EDF:2017 se nos resentan ciertas mejoras como que los personajes no son tan acartonados  pero tambien queda a deber en otros aspectos:

Pros:
-Buen diseño de escenarios .
-Interesante destructibilidad de entornos caracteristico de la serie.
-Diversion frenetica para pasar buenos ratos  y en cooperativo si es osible seguramente mejor.
-El modo supervicvencia de oleadas es divertido.
-Un variedad de diferente stios de unidades de infanteria con sus ropias armas y caracteristicas .

Contras:
-Muy corto poco más de 17  o 15 misiones, no recurdo bien (EFD:2017 predecesor de este tenia 25), la rejugabilidad depende der repetir la campaña en diferentes dificultades o para desbloquear el queipo de el resto de las clases de soldado .
-En frentar a los insectos es divertido enfrentarte a los enemigos aereos sobre todo las naves transortadoras  ueder ser repetitivo , tedioso y agobiante en niveles bajos e incluso con equio avanzado. 
Lo corto de la camaña afecta enormemente la progreción y la rama de mejoras de armamento  lietralmente tendrias que repetir la camaña varias veces para desbloquearle bien el equipo a todas las clase de tropa a usar disponibles . 
-Los vehiculos como tanques , Mechas, torretas en el modo campaña se desperdician y se relevan a unas cuantas misiones. 
-Pues el juego tiene un gran potencial en linea y cooperativo sobre todo  en el modo sobrevivencia pero al ser viejo no arece haber muchos con quien jugar. 
-El peor y es el que ha arado de forma subita el continuar jugando el juego, parece que puede presentar problemas con el salvado de datos , a mi se me corrmopio  el salvado de el partida en nube , tenia planeado sacarle unas 6 horas de juego más .
-pese a la tematica y centrarse en los insectos  mutados por los alienigenas una mayor variedad  de enemigos hubiera estado bien .

 [spoiler]  El juego  y la saga en general  se distinguen  por que no es seria, manejar un humor tan pesimo y malo que es bueno a modo de efecto "Wiseau" y cosas como el doblaje sobre actuado y malo es inherente y cometamente intencional, no hay EDF sin doblaje  malo y humor pesimo. [/spoiler]  

Aun asi  no dejo de recomendarlo, es un juego frenetico, disfrutable  y muy divertido idoneo para llevarse en las ventas y descuentos  , los Dlc que ofrece son muy opcionales y creo que  no aportan mucho al final , pues lleva insecticida a montones , salva nueva Detroit y al mundo, el servicio de fumigación de plagas de gran escala ha llegado.

40908603.review:
Привет ребят!

Не с пыла - с жару, но на относительно свежих эмоциях, спешу поделиться развёрнутым мнением по EDF:IA. 
В общем, штука в том, что это игра про геймплей. По сути одинаковый, отличающийся разве что 4 классами и имеющимся у них оружием. Фарм и ещё раз фарм. Опыт, деньги, опыт, деньги.

 Для меня самым отвратительным моментом игры стала пошаговая прокачка. Сейчас объясню... Есть три уровня сложности, тут всё стандартно - нормальная, тяжёлая и соответственно хардкорная. Каждый из 4 представленных классов (типов брони) может быть прокачен до 8 уровня. Но беда в том, что сразу войдя в игру не выйдет поиграть ни на тяжлой ни на хардкорной сложностях, потому что оружие, присутствующее в арсенале уровней 1-4 вообще не убивает даже муравьёв. Точнее худо-бедно можно пробовать, прокачавшись до 4-го ощупывать тяжёльняк, и только к 6 - 7 уровням лезть на хардкор, в противном случае, я повторюсь, никого убить тупо не получится. 
 И тут у человека может возникнуть ощущение, что в этом ничего страшного нет. Нет? Ну, казалось бы, пройди игру на нормале, прокачаешься до тяжёлого. Пройди на тяжёлом, прокачаешься до харда. Хрен там ночевал! Придётся раз за разом фармить опыт на одних и тех же картах, потому что сюжета тупо мало для прокачки. 
 Качаете вы, значит, один из классов. Долго. Нет, не так... Дооооооолго качаете. И вот, многие ачивки уже открыты, или открыты почти (это я про те, где надо 10000 муравьёв убить к примеру), и вроде бы скоро финал... Но тут в вашу голову приходит страшная мысль: "ЕЩЁ 3 КЛАССА!!!". 0_о

 Это был самый минусовой момент игры. Далее попробую затронуть остальные аспекты и более-менее прикинуть - стоит оно вообще потраченого времени, или всё-таки нет. 

1. ГРАФОНИЙ. Оно тут есть, но уровень довольно посредственный. В принципе взрывы, падения зданий, брызги жижицы из насекомых - всё это выглядин нормально, но чёрт подери! Тут нет ни намёка на кастомизацию персонажей, кроме очень захудалой смены цветов брони. Очень захудалой - это я серьёзно сейчас. Моделей пушек престпно мало. Автомат 1-го уровня никак не отличается от автомата 7-го уровня. Скажете - ничего страшного? А как вам тот факт, что вообще все автоматы одинаковы?) Может я не совсем прав, но все снайперские винтовки точно выглядят абсолютно одинаково.
Кровь насекомых на бойце практически сразу исчезает. Как и все останки самих насекомых. Анимация движения героев терпима, не больше. 

2. ЗВУК. Музыка имеется, она не плохая. Не запомнилось ничего конкретного, но в целоом, помню, что некие нотки эпичности были. Озвучка качественная. Для знатоков английского придётся по вкусу. Стрельба, взрывы и прочая вакханалия ничем не выделяется. 

3. СЮЖЕТ. Тут надо отметить что никаких кат сцен, никаких историй и предысторий не будет. Хотите узнать что то о вселенной, в которой происходит действо - читайте в интернете. При этом персонажи поддерживают бодрые и забавные диалоги, и даже (тут аплодисменты и восторги) сделали сюжетный твист. Спойлерить не буду, но это дичь на самом деле. 

4. ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ. Вроде нормально. На самом деле, если набрать толпу, можно очень прикольно провести время. Но при игре в соло, как я уже сказал, всё превращается в гнусный, бессмысленный и беспощадный фарм, до жути одинаковый и скучный. 

Отзывы на игру положительные, поэтому я считаю, что наиграв достаточное количество времени и обосновав отрицательные для меня моменты, я с чистой совестью могу поставить отрицательный.

Добра вам!

Az out.

39679412.review:
Edit: Tenho poucas horas na versão do steam mas joguei por muito tempo no XBOX360, a versão do steam é basicamente igual, comprei para jogar com amigos e porque o jogo merece

Cada parte desse jogo é mais ridicula e explosiva do que a anterior e ele sabe exatamente o quão insano esta sendo e não sente vergonha nenhuma de te apresentar varias situações tiradas de um filmes baratos, olha nos seus olhos e fala sem rir 'Isso é extramente sério' mesmo sabendo que não é, divertido do começo ao fim.

Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon é um jogo relaxante e intenso onde o jogador deve destruir todo tipo de inseto gigante e robô gigante, tudo é gigante porque o jogo esta ciente que explodir coisas gigantes é muito bom. No caso de ser relaxante e intenso, em muitos casos é facil se sentir tranquilo e relaxado apenas matando insetos gigantes sem dificuldade e um instante depois se ver no meio de um combate intenso com uma dezena de pequenas naves voando e explodindo metade da cidade já que maior parte do cenário em Earth Defense é destrutivel, se um prêdio atrapalha sua mira é só pegar uma bazooka e demolir ele.

Existem quatro classes jogaveis, cada uma tem habilidades que sempre ajudam no objetivo principal: Matar mais insetos. Um deles pode colocar turrets e mina terrestres mantendo uma área protegido, outro tem um jetpack e alta mobilidade que permite sair zunindo de um lado para o outro e o ultimo é um iron man armadura com um escudo de energia antes do Rein de overwatch roubar a ideia. Tem um soldado também mas ele parecia tri chato então não joguei com ele '-'

Vou ser sincero, não faço a menor ideia se o jogo tem historia ou não, ele tem um modo missão que é o principal que se joga mas eu não prestei atenção em nada do que estavam falando, cada missão era só um pretexto para explodir coisas maiores.

O jogo é repleto de armas, algumas tão exageradas quanto o proprio jogo que não tenta criar qualquer restrição, quer começar a primeira missão usando um lançador de granadas e uma bazooka? Esteja a vontade, para melhorar existe um sistema de progressão que te oferece novas habilidades para as classes e novas armas, existem armas que podem ser coletadas matando insetos gigantes mais desafiadores, algumas armas podem parecer até inuteis até a realização 'Aaaah é para isso que serve então!' (Foi a minha experiência com armas que tinham por objetivo perseguir e destruir coisas que voavam muito rapido :|)

O jogo conta com co-op online que é facilimo de criar, ainda mais com a integração steam, roda em praticamente qualquer computador (Rodava no meu notebook com 512 de Video e 4GB de memoria), é divertido em single player e melhor com amigos.

Ò Ò Ò Ò Ganha 4 tangerinas de 5

39502954.review:
I have tried, REALLY tried, to enjoy this game.  I've even found some of the glitches from lazy coding endearing.  But the friendly A.I. is where I have to draw the line.

Every time I try to play on hard or Inferno, I have to carry the entire effort by myself, and if I get downed I have to ASSUME the A.I. will fail to pick me up.  Every time it seems one of them either gets trapped in the map geometry, or tries to pick up the other A.I. on the other side of the map instead of me two feet away because it fell two seconds earlier (and dies in the process), or it prioritizes shooting over picking me up at the WORST possible moments (and dies).

This wouldn't be a problem if the game either had savepoints in missions or let you keep some or your points after a mission failure so you at least kept progressing.  But no, its all or nothing with this game. 

Well it's all or nothing'ed me into not enjoying myself anymore.

38920992.review:
<Original Review>
This game is essentially a wave-shooter, something I have never particuarly enjoyed, but after playing four hours I can safely say this is some of the most fun I've had in a long time. I initially described this as "Dynasty Warriors with guns and bugs", which is hugely reductive, but will give you a sense of what this game is like. The missions are linear, sending you from point to point, either defending an area, destroying spawn points, or fighting a boss, all of which are essentially the same mechanic of 'point and shoot'. Imagine Gears of War without the cover mechanic, plus Dynasty Warriors drops and hordes.

But to compare this game to typical 'wave-shooters' would be a great disservice. The graphics look great, the voice acting is beleivable and entertaining, the swarms of enemies are extremely dynamic in their movement and serve to never let there be a boring moment. Unfortunatley what this game [i]does[/i] do is give you too much of a good thing. Waves last a long time, and defending a single spot for 5-10 minutes can begin to feel tedious, especially when you've been playing for a few hours. You want to love it, you want more, but the few truely cool moments can often get swarmed from having to mow down hundreds of drones (pun intended). This is compounded by the ludicrously slow growth rate - levelling up from rank 1 to rank 2 took 4-5 missions, the XP requirement for the next nevel was doubled, AND each of the four classes level up indipendently, for which I see some serious grinding required in the future.

All that said; the visuals are great, the sense of scale and tone are spot-on [i](Starship Troopers, anyone?)[/i], and I am looking forward to playing more!

<Addendum>
The problem with this game is the required grinding to make any progress. The game is fun enough on your first play through the campaign, even if the final three levels are a god damn nightmare, but by that time you will have only reached level 2 on most the classes. Getting higher than that will require playing though Normal mode a good 4-6 more times to reach level 5, unless you try the higher difficulty. Higher difficulties are an extreme ramp up, more or less requiring you to reach level 5 first, as enemies that are one-hit-killed in Normal can require 3+ full clips to kill on the next difficulty. The campaign itself feels short and pointless without a real ending, and the gameplay is entirely reliant on grinding if you wish to experience anything but the base content. The worst feature of all of this is that getting a game over after playing a single mission for a solid 30 minutes will reward you with nothing, not even a fraction of the XP you would have gained, and for that reason I'm changing my review to a negative one, as I'm entirely done with this game long before I got to see all of its content. This game outstays its welcome far too quickly.

38570938.review: Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon (2011) es la cuarta entrega de una serie de juegos de gran éxito en tierras niponas. En los EDF la premisa es bien sencilla, se trata de repeler con tu escuadrón oleadas cada vez más numerosas (y gigantescas) de mechas y monstruos de naturaleza extraterrestre que asolan una ciudad. Ésta, un campo de batalla en la que los enemigos se cuentan por centenares, donde la destrucción es cada vez más grandilocuente y con la diversión alcanzando su máximo exponente pudiéndose repartir los objetivos en cooperativo. Acción directa y sin concesiones con un poso muy arcade, en donde la historia (muy simple) es un mero pretexto para liarse a tiros, ejecutar esquives in extremis y provocar explosiones que lo devastan absolutamente todo. Gráficamente muy tosco, con una banda sonora correctamente interpretada pero sin llegar a ser memorable y un esquema jugable eminentemente repetitivo, EDF:IA sabe quedar por encima de sus taras gracias a que no quiere ir más allá de sus pretensiones: Serie Z divertida, desenfadada y altamente disfrutable en pequeñas sesiones de juego.

I've always loved these EDF games, complete with the cheesey B-movie references and massive levels to fling crazy weapons around in.  This one was made by another team with a different sense of humor than the Japanese developers, some aspects are more constrained but I found the personalities of the idio.. erm, superiors who advise you on your missions to be slightly more entertaining in this one.  It's different in that you've got 2 sidekicks as well in this, who can revive you, so it's more like an online game experience even in single player.  Some of their lines are great, but the bad thing is there's never a group of random soldiers who burst out into hopelessly naive patriotic songs in the face of humongous enemies destroying half the planet that make EDF 2025/4.1 so awesome.  It's still a grindfest trying to get enough xp/money to get through everything but at least there's way fewer weapon boxes needed and no collecting armor (effectively replaced by xp).

Overall I can see why some people were disappointed by this game, but I wasn't, it's great fun even if it's different.  Right now it's on sale for very cheap, but even at full price I'd say it's worth getting.

Una gran evolución en la saga de EDF. Es verdad que este giro es más hollywoodiense que  el resto de entregas pero da una gran sensación de invasión alienígena y lucha por las ciudades calle a calle.

Esta vez, exceptuando armas, las mejoras de armaduras se harán mediante un sistema de subida de nivel que desbloqueará cosas de manera automática.

En este caso no hay muchos soldados genéricos sino que tendremos dos compañeros bastante inteligentes teniendo en cuenta los cánones de la saga. Además, morir no significa el final de la partida, si no que nuestros compañeros nos pueden resucitar. 

Por supuesto tendremos docenas de bichos para masacrar pero lo realmente llamativo son las unidades alienígenas, menos potentes pero más vistosas y con una gama de movimientos más amplia de la habitual.

Gráficamente no es un juego puntero pero te transmite la sensación de estar en una ciudad real luchando contra una invasión.

También cabe destacar que tendremos objetivos varios a cumplir durante las misiones, haciéndolo más dinámico que el establecido mata a todos los enemigos.

I have played both EDF 2017 and EDF 2025 to completion, and neither was an easy task. The levels get longer, the enemies get harder and more numerous, and pickups are harder to come by.

I would highly recommend this game to those new to the EDF game series as a starter to give a taste for how the games flow.

33944796.review:
Oh boy where to start ?

to be perfectly honest this game's a bundle of bad game design, frustration and lazyness that very nearly prevented more EDF games to be released to the west.

for thoses of you hesitating between EDF:IA and EDF 4.1
DO NOT get Insect armageddon

Its the single worst EDF game out there and you'll get fed up very quickly of the bullsh*t this is gonna put you through
so let me explain WHY its a bad game

First up: Aesthetics 

This game is part of that era of gaming where game devellopers had either all gone colorblind or were in severe depression.
What you'll get here is a bunch generic space marines just barely hiding the fact they're trying to pull the whole "gears of war" non-sense of "little colors, ugly fridges for character" angle, wich move like they've got something stuck in their *ss and reload their guns by stroking it and reaching for lube in between each stroke leading to very delayed results (more on that later), save for a single class wich instead of stroking his shaking his gun arm like he's trying to shake the gun loose instead of reloading it, but at the very least it won't look as aggravating as the former, speaking of guns, each class has ONE model for each gun type and doesn't change dependant on the gun so if you're hoping for good-looking weapons, I've some bad news for you....

Characters aren't the only thing that are lackluster as the game seems to pride itself in the fact all buildings (save for thoses outside the map, more on that later) however the devellopers seem to have very quickly grown shy about that and hid the whole thing behind grey blobs of particle effects wich more often than not last far too long for what they do, not to mention most buildings you'll find here are copy-pasted building wich are crammed together as densely as possible to make extra sure you can't see sh*t when they inevitably get destroyed 

as far as ennemies go they all more or less look like rubber toys of some kind wich either move in the most generic fashion possible 


Now onto gameplay:

What you're looking at here, is the laziest attempt at a third person shooter I've seen yet, and GOD KNOWS I'm not picky,
the main gameplay loop you'll experience is as follows 

Choose class, choose guns (or "buy" basic ones with a slow accumulating money thats earned through score)

go into mission 

shoot things till dead

go to next place 

shoot again

go to next place 

shoot again

hold "use" on something for a couple of seconds (bear in mind if something touches while holding use, the progress on holding use starts over from scratch)

go to next place 

and so on so forth...

Now that wouldn't be bad if the "shooting things" part wasn't as boring as watch grass grow, unfortunately you won't have fun chances are, since you have access to a total of 6 types of weapons, three of wich are useful (as in required to use "useful") and 3 are pointless as you'll literally never have a opportunity to use them to full potential.

Assuming you use the "useful" weapons you'll still have to deal with a design "faux pas" that made me hate Gears of war (wich I'll refer to as GoW for short) with a passion, wich is the active reload system, everytime you reload a gun you get a timing mini-game to reload faster, and unlike GoW, nothing else, again if you like this kind of thing it wouldn't be so bad except for a LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THAT IDEA.


1: Unlike GoW, you have no point during you're in "cover" or safe, the game more or less plays like Serious sam where most of your time spent is spent going one direction and firing in the opposite, so having to deal with that crap on top ain't exactly helping 

2: The way weapons work in this game is that each "weapon" has its own reload timer (during wich the reload animation just keeps looping non-stop till its finished) and the way it works with the reloading game is that fast reloading weapons are easier to reload and slow reloading are harder to reload, wich is the most backwards crap I ever saw, if slow weapons had a easier reload it would help them keep up with faster reload weapons and give you an actual reason to use that one gun that takes 5 seconds of stroking instead of that other gun wich takes 2 seconds (wich can be further reduced to 1 second easily) almost anytime because you're almost guaranteed to out damage the slower gun

Speaking of damage, there is no "strategy" in this game, its just a raw damage race to whoever deals more damage as your pathetic mobility won't help you dodge 9 times out of 10, in fact the most likely way you'll die is by damaging yourself with your own gun

Speaking of health and guns, each class has a "EXP bar" wich fills using score from the missions you complete, until you "level up" your stats will sit there doing nothing, so if you find a mission too difficult, all you can do is find a mission and spam the hell out of it till you actually level up and gain access to guns wich aren't quite as pathetic, and do I have some bad news for you if you hate grinding.

first up the AI squad mates the game gives you will siphon away score by killing mobs, making your accumulation of score even slower on top of them being retards that can make your explosive weapons go off in your face point blank, have them try to shoot "through" you and subsequently deal you damage, perhaps even stunning you if the bot attempts using a explosive weapon of his own....on top of that the option to disable them must be UNLOCKED by completing a, thankfully, pathetically short campaign of 15 levels (for comparison EDF 4.1 has a minimum of 89)

secondly the amount of score asked per level up is far too high to make the game enjoyable as if you ARE grinding to make it less of a chore, peoples say that playing dark souls games is "like bashing your head against a wall until the wall breaks" and I say NAY, THIS is bashing your head against a wall INDEED, its slow, painful, frustrating and after you're done you get to see YET ANOTHER wall you need to bash and that one's even bigger...

and the "difficulty" levels of the game wich are supposedly what gives it more replayability does litterally nothing but multiply all the stats of the mobs by 3, thats it, no new ennemies, no new attacks, no new weapons, no new vehicles (long story short about thoses, they have more health move slower and do less damage than your character and out of 6 vehicles 4 of them are turrets and arguably the mech is a turret with legs)

at the end of the day, the game feels like a unity asset flip: ugly, lazy and boring as sin

Для начала, стоит описать сеттинг. Есть некие Ravagers. Они [strike] набигают[/strike] атакуют землю с невнятными мотивами. Впрочем, кого они вообще интересуют? Нас волнует лишь то, что для атаки они используют орды насекомых размером с вагон. Вы будете играть за 1 из 4 классов в составе Команды Молния, выполняющей различные поручения командования. В основном они сводятся к выпиливанию всего на своем пути, иногда с использованием техники. 
Весело ли это? Ну так, на троечку. Проблемы EDF:IA в паршивой проработке именно геймплейной части. Все автоматы одинаковы. Все гранатометы почти идентичны. Дробовики, ракетницы - смело добавляйте в список все оружие игры. Разнообразие не завезли. Они выглядят одинаково. Они звучат одинаково. Они стреляют почти одинаково - с небольшими вариациями в виде количества снарядов за раз и области поражения. Весело ли в это играть? Надоедает через полтора часа.

Почти точный диалог из игры.

Строго отмеренное количество врагов будет атаковать вас на выданной позциии. Если вы пришли сюда после EDF4.1 - забудьте про мисии с эпическими битвами, забудьте штурм катакомб, оборону на руинах города под сабатон, драку с годзиллой на кулаках - тут этого нет.

5/10. Купите 4.1, там защищать землю на порядок веселее.

31413888.review:
This game is viewed as the worst in the series but is personally my favourite and a Xbox 360 childhood gem.

Pros:

+ Weapons collection although extremely grindy is much improved from previous game

+ Armour system heavily improved

+ Much more optimized although some people aren't bothered by the performance and would rather have 100's of bugs on the screen at once which is understandable but the game was never unplayable and stayed at stable frame rates unlike previous titles.

+ Good amount of variety to enemys. Ants, spiders and wasps. Those three in mechanical varient. Hector, Carrier, MK2 Hector, Daddy Long Legs, Final Boss, Queen Ant, Gun ship, Bomber Spider and Ticks. 

+ Class system is a nice addition (Trooper, Tactical, Battle and Jet)

+ Active reload although ripped straight from Gears of War is a good mechanic to speed up reloads

+ Levels seem more structured

+ Every thing is destructible

+Good amount of game modes:
Campaign
Campaign Remix
Survival
Coop

Cons:

- Much less enemys on screen at once

- Achievements will drive you to insanity especially surviving 500 total f*cking waves of survival when you can only survive 2 maybe 3 if your skilled waves each session by your self. You will be done with survival mode and the very words "survival mode" will haunt you whenever you see them in other game after playing just 100 waves. 10,000 gun ship kills is also another really fun challenging achievement. Said no one. Even worse some how arrives the horrendously time consuming achievement "Daddy WarBugs" earning this one is equivelent to leveling up all armours to max more than twice which is around 100 hours on its own.

- The grind is a never ending slog which the previous con will pretty much sum up. This "500 waves of survival" achievement is the very concept of this game "stretch your paitence and sanity as thin as possible" you'll be brain dead once you 100% this game. 

- Survival mode charactor customization is very small. Two guns in each catagory, forced to play Trooper and no special ability.

- Huge difficulty spike on second to last level. It thinks throwing everything at you at once is difficulty and challenge. You will get through all other levels fairly easy solo. On this one though its a different story... part one pits you against hundreds of mechanical ants and mechanical spiders, beat most of them and you will be pitted against 6 hectors. Beat them and advance to the queen ant and youll be faced with an endless flow of ants, endless flow of mechanical wasps (4 at once), 3 hills (one mechanical spider and the two others mechanical ants and to top it all off, the Queen ant attacking you. Pair this with the inept AI getting stuck on the rocks when trying to come to revive you or simply trying to jump over ledges that are too high making them stuck and forcing you to waste time downing them and reviving. This makes for really frustrating game overs. Game over? Guess what? Your going to have to kill the hundreds off mech spiders and mech ants at the beginning and the 6 hectors to have another shot.

30838613.review:
Oh boy...this fucking game...well, wrote a Review for EDF4.1, may as well do it here too.

In said previous review of Earth Defense Force 4.1, Shadow of New Despair...I said this game was like an American Made Mutation of a fantastic Japanese Series. Kind of like how we tried to make our own "Godzilla" of some kind but called it "Zilla" instead, and it apperently sucked. Hard. (Thankfully the original creators bought his Licenseing out, comepletely remade his bio and such, and proceeded to absolutely murder him in the first movie he came in. Or at least that's what I heard.)

This game, thankfully, is not EXACTLY like Zilla. It wasn't terrible but...it's still a sort of Black Sheep of the franchise for a good reason. It tries it's best to stay close to the formula of the classic games...but it feels as if it's tried to downgrade most, if not all, of the aspects they tried to stick to. 

For instance: This game is friggen SHORT. Only around 15 or so different missions for the campaign plus a few Survival Missions which take place in the exact same maps, which is NOTHING compaired to even the Very First EDF Game on the Playstation. To compare, 4.1 has 89 missions in the Solo Campaign, 9 Bonus Missions in the the Multiplayer to make it 98 there, 23 or so missions in the first DLC Pack for the game, and 20+ in the second pack. That's close to TWO HUNDRED INDIVIDUAL MISSIONS to do!

Next, it's difficulty. This game only has three to choose from...yeah. JUST THREE. Normal, Hard, and Inferno. Compaired to the norm of EDF, which is FIVE, this is yet ANOTHER downgrade because it makes the game way...WAY less accessable. Say you're a New Player to the game, and you start on Normal. If ya find yourself being a bit challenged on there, say it's actually the first Shooter that you as a Player have gotten into and don't know how to properly play, you could go to Easy and ease yourself a bit slower into it, and work your way to the harder difficulties. That is nowhere near the case here.

Another thing I should mention is how the player grows stronger here. In the other games, only your Equipment grows stronger as you collect bits and pieces to up your Arsenal and Armor. Everything else? Depends on YOUR skill. Depends on YOUR Talent. Your reactions, your planning, your aim, everything. It's mostly on YOU to get you through the fights. It's all on your own Experience.

Not here. This game goes for a pretty damn basic method of getting you stronger for the fights ahead. You can collect some weapons out in the field when you defeat certain enemies, sure...but for the most part? You're grinding Mission after Mission not to collect gear...but to get more Currency and Experience POINTS. These, respectively, allow you to buy your character more gear, and Level You Up increase your HP Ammount and the weapons available to purchase. To me, this system isn't as Immersive, as Creative, or as FUN as the other games.

Speaking of Fun, my next topic is just that. The fact that this game isn't as Fun as the actual EDF Series. Hell, some people (me included) could find this game...kinda boring really. Besides JUST having 15 missions, they don't really even seem to feel any different at all.

The Classic EDF Games hold some kind of Magic that keeps every single mission feeling fresh and fun to fight through. It's all fairly Colorful and Vibrant, you can Explore every inch of the map you're given in each mission within it's MASSIVE boundaries, Explosions feel Inherently Satisfying, Bug and Robot corpses litter the battlefield after exploding into Blood or...well just flat out explode to let you see how much you've accomplished...and it all just douses you in Internal Happiness that you simply can't stop,

This game? Is almost the complete opposite. Everything is put into more "realistic" boring brown filters, Explosions feel like you're shooting Weak-Ass Firecrackers at the Enemy (Classic EDF had BETTER Firecrackers as an ACTUAL WEAPON), The maps are far more linear due to stupid plot reasons (i'll get back to this in a second), the Enemy Corpses disappear as soon as they die, and it's all just so slow and sluggish...it's like you're going through a Daily Slog each and every time you come across a horde of enemies. That's terrible, really.

But it gets worse when I move on to My Last and MOST CERTAINLY Least favored aspect of this game: It's story. Oh god, it's story is just...no. THIS aspect is just flat-out ruined, and is the worst part about the game bar-none. Classic EDF had Rediculous Basic. "Giant Insects and Massive Machines have come to destroy everything we love and hold dear! Here, take this FORT KNOX LEVEL OF GUNS stuffed in your locker, fellow EDF Soldiers with their own funny Dialogue who will dance and Sing with you on command, and an EXTREME amount of PURE HYPE, and go save our world!"

This game? STUPID Basic. "Our mission is to save the world from the threat of Large Bugs and Accompanying Machines. Here is a truck filled with a large arsenal that you can use. You will have two Squad Mates who will follow and assist you in combat, but you can't interact with them even though they have randomized voice lines that aren't interesting. Follow our waypoints, stick to your objectives, follow this linear path because the Ravagers have created Barriers that we can't cross through-" Ugh, okay yeah. I can't even continue with that...i've made MYSELF uninterested.

The worst part is? They actually tried (and failed miserably) to make it a little bit more serious. The Highest Points of it, which really isn't saying much, goes as follows. They build up this mysterious "Cube", only for them to say later that it's basically just a really powerful bomb. They activate said Cube to completely destroy a Giant Insect-...oh sorry, they also call THOSE Ravagers here for some stupid reason. They activate it to destroy a RAVAGER Nest, only for their escape chopper to crash and burn, and command says that your team will be "acceptable losses". Oh, and the Mothership just appears from out of nowhere at the Final Mission.

{Spoilers Ahead}
[spoiler]And the Bonus Ending on Inferno...oh GOD the Bonus Ending, just...just don't. It's terrible. It's stupid, it sucked, it was cheesy in a horrible way...it was just terrible. The Normal ending leaves you to question whether or not your team survived an attack from said Mothership after an old friend came in to rescue them via Helicoptor, or died either from the crash or from the explosion of "The Cube". So that was at least KIND of interesting. But the Bonus Ending just throws that all away and-...ya know what? No. Fuck it. FUCK IT. I'm NOT even gonna say it! It is not worth your time! Don't even look it up on Youtube! Just...don't![/spoiler]

With all that being said however...i'm sure there are some people out there who may enjoy this format of game. There is a Philosophy across this world that, if you search long and hard enough: There IS a game out there that can possibly suit you. This one could very well be yours if you take a look at it yourself.

For me however, it was a no-go. My final rating is a 4/10 with a No Recommendation.

29295083.review: Loads of simple, replayable fun. The campaign is short, but the four classes and large variety of weapons and equipment to choose from makes missions a joy to revisit. The graphics are dated but perform well. Animations are smooth and the game hardly slows down with tons of crap on the screen. I recently purchased this game through Steam, and boy, online is dead. I haven't tried to play the campaign co-op, but I could not find a single person to play survival. This is a shame because this is clearly a game designed around co-op play. Your AI squad mates in the campaign are competent, but things would go so much more smoothly if I had a human player or two. The survival mode is a wave defense game type that is also highly replayable. The downside here is, unlike the campaign where you have multiple classes, you can only choose one class for survival - the trooper. You can still equip him with the trooper specific unlocks you acquire for him during the campaign, but why the developers chose to limit class selection for this game type is beyond me. It severely detracts from the game's lifespan. Since this game has been out for a while, I'm beyond hoping they will patch it in. If you have some friends to play with or are simply dying for some chaotic old school shooter mayhem, pick this one up.

Made by a different team than EDF 2017, 2025 & 4.1.  The American made Earth Defence Force Insect Armageddon is still a fun crazy third person shooter that likens itself to Sandlot's EDF series with its own unique flare.

It's not as insane as the other EDF titles, or as difficult. It's a bit easier to slide on into, and most of the other classes perform better off the bat than 2025/4.1.  It does require a considerable amount of grind just like the other EDF titles.

The campaign is relatively short, but for 10 bucks, it has a lot of fun to be had. It's not as good as the other EDF titles, but it's not bad either. It's worth owning if you like EDF.

Many will criticize this game for "being horrible", "a laughing stock of the EDF lineup", "the ants are racist", and "it gave my dog hives and slept with my aunt Ruth!".   The criticizing never ends when this game is mentioned in the same paragraph with "EDF".  However it's not THAT BAD of a game.  Really, it's got a special spot on the shelf next to other EDF games.  I will admit that I DID have more fun with 2017 and 4.1(japan 1st, then PS4, soon *PC) as they had many more levels, more variety, and more replayability in acquiring stuff.  (side note: I was so excited about EDF 4.1 that bought the Japanese version when it released on PS4.  Then the US version when it released for PS4.  As soon as the Steam edition hits a sale I'm buying it too!)  So those are better games and are true to the feel of what people call EDF.  However this game is STILL and EDF title, it is just by a different publisher and that means it has a different feel and taste to it.   Is it awesome?   YES.  Is it full of bugs? :P  YES, and spiders, and giant metal mantis robots too!  (no software bugs that I've found!)  Also unlike 4.1 (as of yet 8/16) it does have genocide guns for each of the armors, which are freaking awesome.

24645779.review:
A darker, grittier version of the wacky budget game Earth Defense Force. While it is certainly the most visually impressive installment in the EDF series, it also feels the most hollow. As far as I'm concerned (and I'm sure many EDF fans will agree with me) much of the charm the series possesses comes from the over-the-top, colorful and corny action and dialouge which is completely lacking this time around.

Don't get me wrong, the massive hordes of insects to shoot are still there and the gameplay has hardly changed at all, but it still doesn't "feel" like an EDF game to me. The drab colors and serious overtones make it seem like this game was a blatant attempt to cash in on the often too serious and "dramatic" American war movie tier trope seen in games like Call of Duty and the like.

All things considered it is a decent little timewaster if you're just looking for that mindless shooting itch to scratch and for ten bucks you could definitely do worse.

My advice though, if you're looking for the definitive EDF experience that you may have heard others gush about, get EDF 4.1 and ONLY jump to this one if you've exhausted yourself on that and are looking for a bit more.

24478147.review:
Returned to this after trying 4.1. Personally found this much more fun and playable 'out of the box' - where it falls down IMO is in holding your interest in the long term. Pros and cons below.

What I liked:
- very fun to pick up and play 'out of the box'
- nice variety of classes to suit different playstyles
- all classes feel fun to play from the start
- controls for each class 'feel' right (and are fully customisable)
- more of a gritty 'Starship Troopers' aesthetic for the suits than the anime look of 4.1 (personal preference)
- good variety of weapons for each class (and fun to use) - but a bit limited within tiers (see below)
- amusing dialogue (though this does get old)

What I didn't like:
- huge amount of grinding for xp and cash at higher tiers - despite the fun gameplay, I suspect that a lot of people would eventually get bored and stop playing before reaching the final tier given the limited choice of missions (see below).
- very limited number of missions compared to say 4.1 - makes the above grinding feel more 'grindy', even with the 'Remix' option
- most of the missions are pretty long - and you have to complete them to get any reward - again, not very friendly for the amount of farming/grinding required to progress at higher tiers.
- lack of variety in mission environments
- while there are a large number weapons to collect overall, the number for each class within each tier seems quite limited - makes weapon farming less interesting, especially at higher tiers.
- only 3 difficulty levels (I think 4.1 has 5)
- dumb AI team-mates (though still better than nothing)
- 'Survival mode' wasted by only allowing one class and limited weapon choice.
- while the a design of the suits and ravagers is nice, the environmental graphics look really basic by today's standards, with really limited graphics options.
- Ticks

What I'd like to have seen (perhaps by DLC):
- many more missions and environments
- many more weapons at higher tiers
- updated graphics
- a survival mode that allows you to use any of your existing suits and weapons
- more randomisation in Remix mode, not just enemy types, but spawn points, objective locations etc.
- more enemy types

24472432.review:
I picked this up upon hearing that EDF 4.1 was coming to Steam, and I wanted to try out the gameplay, I'm glad I did, this game was extremely entertaining. The gameplay is simple but satisfying. You pick one of 4 characters, equip some weapons, and kill tons of enemies. Think Serious Sam only as a 3rd person shooter.  You usually have certain objectives to complete in game although they aren't complicated, mostly a way to get you to move to a different area. There are also plenty of vehicles and turrets to help you. The game looks nice for a 7th gen game, but in my opinion the sound mixing is a little off, so you may want to tinker a bit in the menu. A good 360 port overall though. You might think fighting tons of enemies might get boring, but the action stays engaging. The game is pretty short however, there are 15 levels but different difficulties. Don't just jump into the highest difficulty however. You need to get weapons during the level, which you then buy using in game money you earn from missions. Your character level and weapons carry over which is how you survive on higher difficulties. It's a bit grindy but the gameplay is fun you won't notice. The biggest issue is probably the larger enemies which can get bullet spongey. FIghting huge enemies and carriers can get a bit repetitive, even if you're at a decent level. 

Overall a really fun, albeit short shooter. It has it's flaws but at it's price I'd recommend it for some mindless fun.

24438901.review:
Disclaimer~ I have played this more on the PS3 version of game

I've heard so many negative things about this game. This is odd, because the reviews are very positive on the Steam page. The negativity seems to be very similar to what Duke Nukem Forever struggled with. Players that remember the previous titles wanted a specific experience the new one didn't deliver on. Like Duke Nukem Forever, this game isn't actually that bad as long you judge it for itself rather than the others. 

I have not played the previous title of Earth Defense Force. I can only say that my experience with this title was simply positive. Do I think this is the best thing since gravy? No. I will say this was a better Starship Troopers game than the actual Starship Troopers game. 

The gameplay is okay. It's not too slow, it feels like it's actiony enough for it to be arguably be considered fast paced. While it is fun at first, I will say that the weapons you start with get very dull after awhile. All the enemies you fight, they have a lot of health. This causes you to resent yourself for choosing any of the fully automatic weapons later in the game. The solution is to have slower rate of fire weapons or missile based weapons. 

It gets more tedious, however, when you start unlocking the good weapons that hit the targets for you by heat seeking them. You could literally aim at the sky and the missiles will figure out the rest for you. This basically means that you don't even have to play the game anymore to play the game. 

This is sad, because I feel it could be very gun to combat against enemies with a variety of firepower instead of feeling I have to use specific type of weapons. I cannot help but feel a simple solution would be to just make each weapon have different strengths and weaknesses rather than just saying "these are the best weapons, you unlock them later."

The player can also pick classes of soldier, which is an interesting touch. There is one with a jetpack, another that's compensating speed for other perks, etc. You can pick based on your playstyle. Downside when playing online? The fastest player gets all the kills and all the tanks sorta just show up late to the party, thus you can argue you're being punished for picking the armor class soldier. Though, not as punishing as being the one guy that picks a cannon based weapon while the other players spam rockets into the sky and hits everything in the area.

The enemy diversity isn't drastically huge, it's pretty limited. It isn't so small that you will get bored right away, but it does tarnish replay value. That's the same with the actual missions, they're all the same. The game just doesn't feel interesting as far as goals or purpose. You sorta just play to kill.

Online has some expected choices, such as survival. It's okay, it's not super enjoyable because of the weapons once again as earlier mentioned. The main attraction is just coop for the main game, the "story" I guess we'll call it. 

Overall, it's a positive experience. It's an okay game, kinda like how some B-Movies are an okay movie. You might not play that movie a whole lot, you'll watch it every time and again. This game? I beaten it on PS3 for single player and never touched it since. I have a hard time wanting to play it on PC. I do think $10 is worth it, but maybe even wait for a sale.

6/10

Pros-
Cheap game, good experience
Gameplay is pretty fun and exciting at first. 
Some variety of player customization, such as weapons and character class
You fight giant bugs
You get what you paid for.

Cons-
Replay value is low
Gameplay is pretty lacking for the long term, it's like a firework. Exciting at first, then you realized you've spent some money on something for very temporary satisfaction that could have gone elsewhere.
The game feels lacking and empty as far as content goes, even though I cannot figure out as to why. 
Some weapons are poorly balanced, some are easily spammed and take any skill out of the game, thus all the satisfaction of playing. Ruins the game for other players as well that don't get to kill anything because of their power.

6/10. A positive experience. Not a bad game, but not great.

24419111.review:
I don't get the negativity for this game.  It seems like people generally think this was a bad entry into the franchise, but I haven't seen the problems.

The game is about 20 minutes of new and unique content, interspersed with immense amounts of grind.  You get more powerful weapons with credits and random drops.  You need more powerful weapons and higher levels as missions proceed, because the difficulty curve is wildly inconsistent and enemies become bullet sponges very quickly.  Thus, to proceed you get to the point where you grind early levels for the credits and random drops required to progress.  To my understanding that is the series formula.


The AI is terrible, and often suicidally runs into combat.  The enemies aren't challenging, but they tend to attack in the middle of reloading animations and double the time they take.  The achievements are...frustrating time sinks.  I think the worst part of this game is that you have to grind through it an immense amount of times, because the separate classes all require experience building and the purchase of new weapons to make them viable.


All of this said, the game is good stupid fun.  Grab a couple of friends, spend an afternoon grinding, and completely forget about the game two days later.  It costs less than some movie tickets, doesn't aspire to being something high concept or avant garde, and revels in stupidity (if you beat the last level on the highest difficulty you'll know exactly what I mean. 



All in all it's a good game.  Not great, deeply flawed, buggy for a long time (the radar function was enabled my default for the longest time, removing the need for the support unit's special ability), but satisfyingly shallow and fun.  Maybe 4.1 will be better, but I can't really say I'm unhappy about this game.

24196209.review:
Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon is a semi-reboot of the series and is the only game in the series not made by the original developers Sandlot. It takes place around the same time of EDF 2017 and is set in the city of New Detroit. Upon starting the game you can either choose to play the game by yourself or create a new online game for people to join. If you decide to go it alone you will be accompanied by two AI bots named Kid and Cyrus who are not entirely useless but nowhere near as helpful as real players. You can then choose from one of four classes to play as. The Trooper who is your jack of all trades with no real special talents, the Tactical who can lay down turrets and mines, the Battle who is essentially a walking tank with the biggest and most destructive weapons and finally the Jet who can zoom around in a jetpack.

Each class has a different set of weapons exclusive to them and with the addition of being able to change your armor to a few different colors it helps making each class feel unique. So far the game is looking awesome and you eagerly jump into mission 1. The first thing you will likely notice is that this game looks much better than the previous entries and every enemy has been resigned to fit this new, gritty theme it's going for. Personally I actually prefer this art direction compared to the previous entries and it makes it all the more of a shame when you actually start playing it. You see they decided to add RPG mechanics by gathering experience and leveling up your character but the problem lies in that you'll start off completely rubbish.

Your gun barely does any damage, the clip for each weapon is insanely small meaning that you'll be reloading 80% of the time since this is a game about fighting hordes of enemies and probably worst of all is how the Jet class starts off. You know how he has a jetpack? Well yeah, starting off you can very likely jump higher in real life than that thing lifts him off the ground which is just sad to look at and turns him into a glorified roller-skater. 7 hours of playing nearly exclusively as this class and his jetpack is noticeably better after leveling a few times but don't expect to be able to reach most of the surrounding rooftops for a vantage point.

One of the selling points of the game is that it features 300 guns. Well that too is messed up by this completely unnecessary leveling system since whenever you pick up a gun crate from the battlefield they are inexplicably unable to be used until you reach a certain level. Not only does that take the fun out of collecting loot since it takes so long to level up but it also means you will be forced to stick with your rubbish weaponry due to bad game design. Another thing that is really strange is that every weapon of a category looks exactly the same. As an example the first rocket launcher looks the same as the latest rocket launcher you just picked up, the latest assault rifle does too and every other gun has a single weapon model for its entire category. This makes the feel of finally leveling up and being able to use a new gun all the more disappointing.

Using explosives in the midst of battle is still as satisfying as ever since every building is completely destructible and by the end of a mission most of the city will be in ruins due to fierce fighting. Unfortunately these new and improved graphics do come at a great cost. There are red “invisible walls” everywhere and you will quickly notice how small the area you can actually play in are. The game tries to hide this fact by drastically changing how missions are designed. While most of the mission from the previous games set you in a huge environment and tasked you with simply surviving the onslaught, this game is chock filled with way-points you must head to. Go to a certain area and switch a beacon or something equally mundane, fight a horde, then go switch another beacon and rinse and repeat until the game finishes.

This gets old fast and since there are only 15 missions in this game, each of them last quite some time further making the repetition noticeable. The worst part of it all is that this game switched from the cheesy, plain dumb dialogue of the rest of the series and instead went the dull, serious route. I found the dialogue plain unbearable and most every word you hear out of someone’s mouth will be a random string of words like “Bravo Zulu Lightning over” or “Affirmative, Oscar Bravo Lightning Strike”. I guess they were trying to make it sound cool and edgy but it just sounds like a bunch of things kids would say when they take a match of CS:GO far too seriously.

Moving back to the topic of compromises caused by the improved graphics, the amount of enemies that can be on the screen at any one time has been greatly reduced. To give the illusion of facing a horde of enemies they now spawn right around you by crawling out of the ground. This could have been cool if it was used a few times but that is how most of your encounters play out. You go to a way point, receive a string of random words from the mission handler and then enemies predictably pop out of nowhere instantly surrounding you time and time again. Gone are the days when you see hundreds of ants marching to your location as you desperately pick off as many as you can before they reach you. Yes the previous games had graphics right out of the original Xbox but this is a prime case in where graphics are not everything.

Ant hills make a return and still spawn in infinite number of enemies until destroyed. Yes, they messed that up too as you are likely imagining. No longer can you destroy the hill with your rocket launcher that is capable of destroying several skyscrapers with a single blast, now you must walk up right next to the hill and plant a tiny charge on the outside. The worst part of this is that it takes several seconds to set it up and a single hit causes you to start all over again. This was clearly designed to “enhance” coop by forcing your friends to cover you but with how fast most weapons run out of ammo, it's likely they simply won't be able to in many cases. Friendly fire is always on and you will take damage if you mindlessly run in front of a friend that is firing his gun. Your AI companions if playing solo are pretty good at not shooting you but seem to constantly try to get themselves killed when you are firing.

If you are downed they can revive you and you will be back at full health. Once you finish the campaign you will have the option to turn off the AI bots in future playthroughs. You will also unlock a “campaign remix” mode that randomizes the enemies encountered. Not really a mode that makes much of a difference to the missions. You also have survival mode where you can play with up to 6 other players and fight until you all drop. In survival you can only play as the Trooper class, gain no experience and none of your guns from campaign can be used. One thing I must praise this game for is that vehicles are now finally helpful and no longer have controls designed by someone that has never played a video game. It is pretty fun to ride in tanks, mechs or just get into anti-air turrets. There are quite a few new awesome looking enemies added as well. At the end of the day I get the feeling that Insect Armageddon wasn't even originally supposed to be an EDF game due to how badly they messed up the basic features this series is known for. It may be fun for a bit if you plan on playing with some friends but I just cannot recommend it.

EDF has a bit of a following, and to gift those folk with this game could be considered an offence. However for those who have not had the chance yet to experence EDF, you will not exactly be blown away with this one. Unfortunately it lacks immersion, gameplay, graphics, optimisation, sound, weapon quality, enemy AI and general quality, and thats just the top of the iceberg. It's whole foundation compared to the rest of the franchise is just dripping wet with nonsense.

You may think this then to be a negative review, and typically you would be right, but I still had fun playing it. Still had fun bringing down the bosses, still had fun collecting the weapons and leveling up and still had fun rolling through the game again after completing it. Ultimately I have to recommend this title even with it's flaws as it still anchors onto the EDF franchise and there is a smidge of amusement to squeeze out if you want it.

In summary, Earth Defence Force: Insect Armageddon is a title that under-shot it's potential to be a good game, and landed firmly in the OK camp. It's OK, it's fine, just dont expect too much.

21723743.review:
Dieses Spiel ist genau das, wonach es aussieht:

Ein Trashiger Shooter indem man mit endloser Munition gegen eine Invasion von Rieseninsekten kämpft und das solange, bis kein Insektenbein mehr zuckt und die ganze Stadt (höchstwahrscheinlich) in Trümmern liegt. Kollateralschäden bleiben nunmal nicht aus, wenn die EDF anrückt!

[h1]Klassen[/h1]
Zur Verfügung stehen 4 verschiedene Klassen, jede mit anderen Fähigkeiten und Vor- und Nachteilen.
[list]
[*]Trooper - Standardklasse ohne spezielle Fähigkeiten dafür in allem anderen sehr gut
[*]Tactical - Kann Türme, Minen oder ein Radar aufstellen
[*]Battle - Langsam aber tödlich und schwer gepanzert, kann einen Schild benutzen um schweren Schaden zu vermeiden, Elektroschocks abgeben und eine kleine Schockwelle erzeugen
[*]Jet - Benutzt Energiewaffen und kann auf Kosten der Waffenenergie fliegen, ist die Energie leer kann nicht nachgeladen werden, bis diese wieder aufgeladen ist
[/list]

[h1]Modi[/h1]
[list]
[*]Kampange
Die Kampange ist zwar relativ schnell durchgespielt, bietet aber dennnoch einen gewissen Reiz, da nach jeder Mission neue Waffen gefunden werden, mit denen man auch die härteren Schwierigkeitsgrade schaffen kann (um dort bessere Waffen freizuschalten etc... xD)
[*]Survival
Im Survival-Modus kämpft man gegen endlose Wellen von Gegnerscharen
[*]Campaign-Remix
Hier spielt man die Kampangenmissionen nochmal aber die Gegner und Bosse werden zufällig ausgewählt, um für etwas Abwechslung zu sorgen.
[/list]

An den Errungenschaften merkt man schnell, worauf das ganze abzielt... Tausende und Abertausende von Invasoren zu vernichten!

Also schnappt euch eure Freunde und zieht in den Krieg gegen Ameisen, Spinnen, Wespen, Zecken, Rieseroboter und mehr!

Ich hoffe, das in Zukunft noch weitere EDF-Teile ihren Weg hierher finden und es nicht nur bei diesem einen Ableger bleibt!

[h1]Anhang[/h1]
Hat euch das Review gefallen oder ihr habt einfach Interesse am Schreiben von Reviews, dann unterstützt doch bitte unsere noch im Aufbau befindliche Gruppe [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/germanicusreviewius]GermanReviews[/url]

21677901.review:
Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon (Alternative Title: "Kill Aliens With Bloom: The Game") is a game where you shoot giant bugs and some alien ships. If you’re familiar with the other games in the series, like 2017 and 2025, be aware this is a different game due to not being developed by Japan.

Overall, the game is nice. While best played with friends, the game does allow for AI teammates that will try their best to revive you when you go down, as well as supplying supporting fire. Dialogue in the game is humorous, in a silly sort of way. Guns are somewhat unique, although on a much smaller scale than other EDF games. (You ever shoot a rocket launcher and find out it splits into a bunch of swirly plasma missiles that crash down and bombard the area?) The feel of each class is enjoyable, and I don’t feel completely useless if my class’s specialty fails (looking at you, 2025). Each class has their own thing they do, and they stand out from each other. Except... maybe Trooper. That's the normal jack-of-all-trades class. No specialty, just "flexibility" to choose from any weapon class to use. Bless your soul if you choose to play Trooper.  

Cons. Campaign is short. I suppose this is meant to be remedied by the Campaign Remix mode, and three difficulty levels, but I know some people tend to drop games once the campaign is finished. Not to mention that repeating missions can get very boring. As far as I’m aware, absolutely nobody plays Survival mode. Story is weak. It doesn’t even get resolved, even with the alternate ending. It's assumed you're just here to shoot bugs and aliens, and doesn't give you much more. This game is kind of old and not incredibly popular, online multiplayer will probably be a little empty. I can’t say I checked. If you want to keep playing after beating the campaign, maybe you think Inferno difficulty will be a fun challenge, understand you will be in for a real grind. Achievement hunting? Haha. You’re in for a long ride. 

If those things don’t really seem that awful, well, give it a spin. The game was fun enough for me to play it on two systems.

21556365.review: Amazing Game full of explosions and a ton of awesome bosses and weapons. Game gets difficult after a few levels and can be a real challenge to play alone.

21509123.review:
A fun game to pick up and play for a few hours at a time. This shooter places you into a very well scripted b-movie vibe millitary shooter.(Playtime does not reflect my substantial offline time commitment)

Obviously you fight giant bugs and robot bugs in the streets of New Detroit with either two generic NPC soliders who don't really get a chance to show you much of thier personality except through the generic chatter they exchange during missions. Or you can replace the NPC's with online players (a much more helpful prospect, the NPCs are tragically underprepared for air combat). While the game advances or the waves of survival continue the types and abilities in enemies introdces new ways the enemy tries to bring the battle to you. The enemy types range from simplistic, to ludicrous health walls, or in the case of most flying enemies extremely challenging targets unless you are carrying the right weapons. 

Luckily the game gives you a massive list of weapons to choose from as you play through and unlock more weapons with interesting differences like specific weapon spreads, tracking, DOT and explosion radius. These all may sound like basic shooter fare, but when coupled with the class abilities for each armor (which each have thier own weapon classes used and level up seperately) makes the experience drastically different for each armor. Wether you fly around with the jetpack, taking carefully aimed sniper shots (or rain death with a rocket launcher) from far above the battlefield, or use the tactical armor to drop turrets to add another gun while blasting with your weapon of choice, or play with the largest weapon selection with the solider or use the heavy to deliver maximum firepower to the enemy.

Unfortunately after beating the main campaign, the story remains totally static, difficulty increases simply give enemies more health, even in the Game + mode the only difference is that enemy types are changed so advanced enemies show up earlier than normal. This makes going back into the story (the only way to advance armor level since survival uses a set level core trooper armor) something of a chore, but with a few friends playing for fun it becomes more enjoyable. Survival is a fun distraction, but without any advancement beyond a number of waves it can become stale once you stop trying out new weapons (especially since you can't unlock new weapons or amor levels in survival) and maps.

All in All: I really like this game on principal, my first playthrough solo was a huge blast, but I regretably didn't get as much out of subsequent returns to the battlefields of New Detroit. Initial Playthrough: 9/10 (only the prolongued sequences of me trying to shoot down aircraft with a shotgun or gernade launcher prevented the ten). Subsequent Playthrough: 6/10 Man.... it just feels grindy once I change to a new armor... and the NPC playstyle only compounds this issue.

Final score: 8/10

EDIT: Some spelling/grammar correction.

When i was much younger, me and my brother were terrible at picking games. we picked the no rep, "meh" review games that werent popular. we didnt care. We picked the game based on the cover. Lo and behold one day we got our grubby hands on EDF 2017. we both together spent at least 300 hours on the game. we never beat it on inferno. that being said, I was excited for this game to come out. after quite a few hours of play, i have come up with two reviews. first one is for long time EDF players, second is for newcomers to the franchise, behold the reviews underneath.

Newcomer review
Pros:
-giant bugs to shoot and kill
-many different unique weapons, including some useless unique ones
-four classes each with their own unique weapos. perks, and skills
-robots
-not your average shooter
-funny comentary
-good replay value
-WTF these weapons are so cool and "weird"! they are not your usual shooter guns

Cons
-gameplay may be repetative especially if you use the same weapons over and over
-30 fps lock
-cant use all weapons with all classes
-short story

Long time EDF players
Pros
-nostalgia
-new enemies
-new maps

Cons
 Okay, before i get into cons, these are for those who specifically want that old nostalgic feel. there will be a lot

-classes. you cant use all weapons with all classes and it loses that feeling of you being just a soldier amongst the ranks
-weapons arent that unique compared to 2017. no assult rifles that have 999 rounds, about as accurate as a political campaign and deals massive damage. no more 100m blast radius rockets. etc.
-hectors dont flinch. i used to spray them just to keep the bullets away, now all you can do is run
-wasps. f*cking wasps. all they do is fly so fast they give you a headache and they have lots of health.
-ant hills dont die after shooting them. you have to plant bombs. bloody annoying when you have 150 ants around you squirting acid and your plant gets reset.
-vehicles are garbage, but even worse than 2017 garbage
-explosions hurt you. no more running into the center of the explosion to pick up the weapons crate
-what a terrible campaign. so short, story is terrible, and levels arent unique. no underground, no beach, just city maps.

overall, great game for newcomers to the series. if you play the game you will LOVE it, but then will wonder just how much better the others can be. if you have an xbox, i recommend you pick up 2017 immediately.

18795181.review:
Having played Earth Defense Force: 2015 on the XBox 360, I had high hopes for the subsequent iteration. While Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon doesn't quite capture the magic of its predcessor, it's still an enjoyable sequel that should be considered by any fans of the franchise or newly interested gamers.

The staples of the series are all there--giant bugs, giant spaceships, and an endless supply of bullets and bombs, The game places more emphasis on a progression system that upends the simplicity of the previous game. Instead of killing bugs to get armor and weapons, you have to earn the weapons THEN upgrade the specific clase enough to unlock the weapon.

The familiar chaos of the series is still as campy as ever. Every building is destructible if enough rockets are thrown at it. Bugs fly in every direction. 

Despite my issues with the class system, it makes the game more interesting in co-op.

Overall, it's a good game and any curious should pick it up during a sale.

※１　星の数の説明は私のプロフィール欄に記載されています。

[h1]【概要】[/h1]
家庭用機で販売されている地球防衛軍シリーズの海外版です。
大量の巨大な昆虫や機械を相手に打ちまくりゲーとなっています。
コンセプトは上記の通りですが、これまでのシリーズと大きく違うので別ゲーと思うほうがいいと思います。
今作ではCOOP機能が実装され、シナリオなら3人、サバイバルなら6人で同時プレイが可能となっています。
１キャンペーン５ミッションで３キャンペーン、合計１５ステージあります。

[b][u]＊＊長所＊＊[/u][/b]
[list]
    [*]兵科が4種あり、好きなプレイスタイルでできる
    [*]過去作にはなかった協力プレイが実装（記述現在マルチは皆無）
[/list]
[b][u]＊＊短所＊＊[/u][/b]
[list]
    [*]武器を入手しても職ごとのレベルが足りないと装備できず、またランクを上げるのが苦痛
    [*]シナリオが中途半端で、かつ短い
[/list]

[h1]【総評】[/h1]
これまでの国内版と比較すると敵の数が少なかったりで想像と違いましたが、正直な感想で意外と悪くはないです。
ただ、一人でやるのではなくCOOPでフレンドをやれたら長く遊べるかもしれません。
短所にも書きましたが、職ごとにレベルがあるため職を変更したら装備のランクが下がるなどで変更が難しく、
全職をそれなりのランクまで上げるのは個人的には作業でしかないため、やる気になれませんでした。
しかし、見た目のアクション性や雰囲気などはさすが海外製ということでこれらをそのままにして国内版と同じ仕様だったら最高でしたね。

Dieses Spiel sieht auf den ersten Blick furchtbar trashig aus - ist es auch. Die Grafik ist nicht die beste, die Handlung ist völlig sinnfrei und vorhersehbar, aber das schöne ist: Das macht gar nichts! 

Das Spiel habe ich ursprünglich gekauft, einfach weil es im Angebot war, lustig aussah zum mal anspielen und einen Coop-Modus (für bis zu 3 Spieler) bot. Also ausprobiert und hängen geblieben.

Die Missionen selbst sind sehr linear, eigentlich muss man immer irgendwelche gigantischen Ameisen, Wespen, Zecken und sonstiges Getier mit wunderbar übersteuerten Mehrfach-Raketenwerfern, Mechs und Sturmgewehren mit Explosivmunition wegschießen. Das macht allerdings sehr viel Spaß, und da macht es auch nichts, die selben Missionen mehrmals zu spielen - sie sind ja eh alle ähnlich. Die vier verschiedenen Klassen spielen sich sehr unterschiedlich und es lohnt sich, alles uszuprobieren. Levelling und weitere Schwierigkeitsgrade und Waffen sorgen für einen gewissen Grad an Langzeitmotivation.

Zwischendurch wirft die Einsatzleitung nicht ganz ernst gemeinte Kommentare ein, wirft mit Internet-Akronymen um sich und streitet sich mit der völlig unfähigen Aufklärungseinheit. Diese empfiehlt dauernd Dinge wie: Der Trick ist, sie zu erschießen, während man gleichzeitig ihren Angriffen ausweicht. Sehr hilfreich. Sorgt aber definitiv für Erheiterung zwischendurch.

Alles in Allem also ein Spiel, das sich für den Preis wirklich lohnt, wenn man auf hirnlose Ballerei mit viel Spielspaß, Humor und riesigen Insekten steht. Wer aber ein tiefgründiges Spiel sucht, ist hier falsch - aber diese Leute wurden wohl eh schon vom Titel abgeschreckt :D

16641737.review:
Earth Defense Force is a third person shooter pitting you against hordes of alien invaders, said invaders are using giant robots and huge bio-enginereed insects to invade our world:  it's up to you to stop them in the 15 campaign missions.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-alien units are well designed and animated

-intense, frantic combat against hordes of insects and robots

-most of the environment can be destroyed, cars blow up and buildings crumble to dust when hit with rockets: this adds a slight strategic layer to things cause doing so increases your line of sight (at the cost of cover) and gives the alien insects less surfaces to crawl on

-dialogue is generally funny, the game really doesn't take itself seriously with soldiers joking and abesnt-minded intel officers taking their time to explain how to beat a boss

-a good amount of armors and weapons to unlock and level up

-very fun when played in coop

-when not playing coop AI companions are quite competent and generally quite effective

[b]CONS:[/b]

-graphics are a tad bland and levels generally look all the same

-unremarkable voice acting

-gameplay is overall simple and boils down to going from point A to B shooting everything that moves

-some enemy waves last a bit too long

-no tutorial whatsoever, thankfully it's easy to pick up and any doubts can be cleared by looking up a FAQ

-a bit on the short side

-leveling up armors takes quite a long time, you'll have to grind missions once you're done with the campaign or simply replay it selecting a higher difficulty

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=466531202

EDF comes out as a straightforward game that offers plenty of mindless fun, shooting tons of enemies and leveling the city using the various over the top weapons at your disposal is truly enjoyable.
There's not much of a story, the characters are cliched and the ending feels hurried but the fact is the game isn't really interested in that stuff: what it wants is to offer you an huge b-movie inspired alien armada-and a few bosses-to blow up alone or with friends: and it does so really well.

I'm not sure the game has alot of staying power once it's done, there's a campaign remix mode that adds different foes and ups the ante a bit but it doesn't really change things much, so you'll have to play survival with friends or just grind campaign missions again to level up everything.

At its sale price of 3 bucks EDF is a really fun albeit simple and short game: if you're into third person shooters and like its campy b-movie style it will not let you down.

I really wanted to be able to give this one a positive review. Even with the rose-tinted glasses of having played and immensely enjoyed the original EDF. The first had its good and bad points, but it was the good points that salvaged the game's bad ones. Yes, repetative gameplay is pretty much the staple of this series, but it never got too boring because of the campy, B-horror tone, the hilarious enemy physics (dead ants bouncing gloriously into the heavens) and the scale and variety of the creatures.

Unfortunately, IA seems to have decided to do away with all that. Gone is the humor. Replaced with a more serious (but still somehow silly) gritty approach. Gone are the physics and the scale. Gone is the variety (well, you get some variety...if you like Spider Type A, B, C. Mix that up with Bee Type A, B, C, etc.). It's nice to have larger maps to explore, but they're hardly inventive or varied enough.  Overall, it was a pretty dissapointing experience.

Yeah, I like that there's a survival mode and a 'remix' of the campaign but I'm sure the devs could've cranked out more than 15 missions. The graphics aren't bad, but EDF was never about having 'amazing' graphics, considering the sheer amount of stuff happening on-screen you hardly have time to notice as you're running from an army of ants and spiders while dodging the blasts of robots that are towering over skyscrapers. The weapons and different soldier types are pretty cool too, and I'm glad to see that the devs decided to bring some variety in that form. I'll recommend this game if it's on sale, but at full price it's kind of hard to suggest, especially when this game has paid DLC, which was a horrible idea for this game. PAID DLC should not have come anywhere NEAR this franchise. In the end, however, this is EDF for the PC and that's quite alright. I just wish it was the EDF that I fell in love with on the Xbox360.

13359762.review:
sorry guys.  i really wanted to like this game.  i mean i REALLY REALLY wanted to like this game.  i have been an EDF fan since GDF days.  i thought, how hard could it really be to make an EDF game?  even i know the formula, these developers surely couldn't have messed it up.

how to make EDF game

1. fill stupidly large area with large amounts of generic destructible objects, i.e. rocks, buildings, etc.
2. put bugs or robots or aliens or something on the map - lots of them, like wayyyy too many
3. make tons of weapons of radically varying levels of actual usefulness and cram them in
4. create mission scenarios that are all as vague as humanly possible cuz they are all the exact same: kill everything
5. crank all engine physics up into the red, then do it again 2x for good measure

just like that, i've made a good EDF game.  so what went wrong here?

EDF is not an action 3rd person shooter series.  it is sooo slow, missions are mind-numbingly long, it's repetitive beyond all reason and you never really feel like you've made any progress in the games because nothing has changed.  you're doing the exact same thing you were 2 missions ago.  literally - nothing has changed.  it has a heavy hypnotic, zen-like quality to it - clearing a massive map is simple but tedious, and there is a special kind of old school arcade pleasure in glancing at your minimap occassionally to see the field of red dots slowly thin.

in insect armageddon, they have forgone that slower pace, and put in it's place a weird checkpoint system where enemies come in individual waves.  they made a decision to have the bodies "vaporize" instead of just explode into the distance - a damn shame considering the gonzo physics has always been a huge draw for these games.  the cheeky humor is intact, although they went for more starship troopers than godzilla.  the guns definitely blow stuff up.  but it just doesn't hit the spot, not for a long-time EDF fan anyways. 

if you're looking to scratch that meditative, map-clearing arcade itch, i highly recommend just picking up Lost Planet: Extreme Condition instead if you don't own it already.  it's not the same as an EDF game and hopefully one day we'll get a real one here but for now it'll have to do.

12580360.review:
This is a pretty good time if you can get it cheap. It's not a 'real' EDF game as it was outsourced to an entirely different studio halfway across the world but thankfully they understood enough to keep things goofy. The biggest departure from the Sandlot EDFs is this game's modern Western mission structure where it's all waypoints and overt setpieces as well as the odd (infuriating) linear vehicle segment. It kind of made me realize the canon EDFs are a lot better designed than they typically get credit for as they manage to get a lot of these moments to happen organically (like, in IA there will be an anthill and a prompt for you to stick a bomb on after which a counter starts running and you have to deflect waves of insects until it blows. In canon EDF there would just be an anthill with bugs streaming out so you end up deciding for yourself to wade in and destroy it so they'll stop coming. The end result is remarkably similar)

Anyway until one of the proper EDFs gets a PC port this isn't a bad way to scratch that itch.
